author: Special Correspondent
text:
The five-day grace period given to employers to deposit their provident fund contributions to Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation has been withdrawn from February.

Regional PF Commissioner I (Madurai Region) Rabindra Samal recently said that the employers had to pay all their PF remittances to the PF office within 15 days of closure of every month.

A grace period of five days was allowed for manual processing of calculation of wages and dues of the employees at the end of the employers. Besides, remittances of the dues in bank also required additional time in the manual set-up.

However, he said, the EPFO had introduced a technological advancement – electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) and remittance of dues through internet banking.

“Now, the employer can make the payment by touch of a button on his computer. Hence, the five days of grace period has been withdrawn,” he said. Madurai regional office comprising nine districts had 21,238 establishments registered with the EPFO.

Among them, 15,639 had got the ECR facility. A total of 10.93 lakh contributory members were enrolled in the region, he said.

Mr. Samal said that the EPFO imposed penalty as a deterrent on the employers who did not stick to the deadline and also collected interest for delayed payment.

Mr. Samal said that Nidhi Aapke Nikat, a grievance redressal meeting held for the employees at their doorsteps, aimed at redressal of all the grievances within seven days.

“At least 95 per cent of the grievances are redressed within seven days,” he said.
title: EPFO withdraws grace period for remittances by employers
